titleStmt.title: The history of the Athenian Society for the resolving all nice and curious questions / by a gentleman who got secret intelligence of thir whole proceedings ; to which are prefixed several poems, written by Mr. Tate, Mr. Motteux, Mr. Richardson, and others.
titleStmt.author: Gildon, Charles, 1665-1724.
R. L.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for James Dowley, and are to be sold by the booksellers of London and Westminster,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Gildon by Wing and NUC pre-1956 imprints.
The Athenian Society, London, was founded 1690-91 by John Dunton for the publication of his Athenian Gazette, or Athenian Mercury--Cf. "Dunton's life and errors", v.1, p. 187-197.
Date of publication suggested by Wing (CD-ROM, 1996).
Imperfect: torn, stained, tightly bound, with loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Cambridge University Library.
